One man may carry his part of the work as far as he can, and then the Lord will send another of His 
                                                                           337
workmen to do another part of the work that the first worker did not feel the necessity of doing, and yet it was essential that the work should be done. Therefore let no man feel that it is his duty to begin and carry forward a work entirely himself. If it is possible for Him to have other gifts in other laborers to work for the conversion of souls, let him gladly co-operate with them.--Manuscript 21, 1894.
